div.p: From Ernst Betche to Charles Moore
ML MSS.1081, Ernest Betche papers, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.
[Betche discusses a proposition for a 'flora' of NSW.]

'V. In order not to exceed the average space of 7 lines, we have to forego: ... all book-references, except to Benth. F. Austr. or to F.v.M's Fragm. all Synonyms, except where the names differ from those of Benth. F. Austr. or of F.v.M.'s Census ... .'

'VIII. The orders are arranged according to F. v. Muellers improved revision of Jussiens's Natural system.' ... 'Several French and German botanists tried to reorganise the system ... but they succeeded only in constituting one imperfect system for another one; till F. v. Mueller, so extremely qualified to such work by his extensive knowledge of plants, solved the difficult question, and succeeded in arraying the orders in an easy natural flow.

I am convinced, Sir, F. v. Muellers System will be the system of the future, and I dare to say, that G. Bentham himself, if he was not unfortunately beyond the reach of consultation, would acknowledge its important improvements, and would approve its adoption.
My second motive, for the urgent recommendation to adopt F. v. Mueller's System, is a mere practical one, i.e.: to secure F. v. Muellers assistance to the work.'

' ... our own observations are naturally but imperfect, and small compared with the rich store of information accumulated in F. v. Muellers vast herbarium. Without F. v. Muellers co-operation the work would remain imperfect from the beginning, and I beg most respectfully and earnestly, when you sanction the work, let it be at once a perfect and independent work.'
